00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  * Simple allocate only memory allocator.  Used to allocate memory at application
00043  * start time.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 130285 $<hr>
00046  *
00047  */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_BOOTMEM_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_BOOTMEM_H__
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #define CVMX_BOOTMEM_NAME_LEN 128   /* Must be multiple of 8, changing breaks ABI */
00059 #define CVMX_BOOTMEM_NUM_NAMED_BLOCKS 64    /* Can change without breaking ABI */
00060 #define CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE     (16ull) /* minimum alignment of bootmem alloced blocks */
00061 
00062 /* Flags for cvmx_bootmem_phy_mem* functions */
00063 #define CVMX_BOOTMEM_FLAG_END_ALLOC    (1 << 0) /* Allocate from end of block instead of beginning */
00064 #define CVMX_BOOTMEM_FLAG_NO_LOCKING   (1 << 1) /* Don't do any locking. */
00065 
00066 /* Real physical addresses of memory regions */
00067 #define OCTEON_DDR0_BASE    (0x0ULL)
00068 #define OCTEON_DDR0_SIZE    (0x010000000ULL)
00069 #define OCTEON_DDR1_BASE    ((OCTEON_IS_OCTEON2() || OCTEON_IS_OCTEON3()) \
00070                   ? 0x20000000ULL : 0x410000000ULL)
00071 #define OCTEON_DDR1_SIZE    (0x010000000ULL)
00072 #define OCTEON_DDR2_BASE    ((OCTEON_IS_OCTEON2() || OCTEON_IS_OCTEON3()) \
00073                   ? 0x30000000ULL : 0x20000000ULL)
00074 #define OCTEON_DDR2_SIZE    ((OCTEON_IS_OCTEON2() || OCTEON_IS_OCTEON3()) \
00075                   ? 0x7d0000000ULL : 0x3e0000000ULL)
00076 #define OCTEON_MAX_PHY_MEM_SIZE ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX)) \
00077                   ? 128*1024*1024*1024ULL \
00078                   : (OCTEON_IS_OCTEON2()) \
00079                     ? 32*1024*1024*1024ull \
00080                     : (OCTEON_IS_OCTEON3()) \
00081                        ? 512*1024*1024*1024ULL \
00082                        : 16*1024*1024*1024ULL)
00083 
00084 /* First bytes of each free physical block of memory contain this structure,
00085  * which is used to maintain the free memory list.  Since the bootloader is
00086  * only 32 bits, there is a union providing 64 and 32 bit versions.  The
00087  * application init code converts addresses to 64 bit addresses before the
00088  * application starts.
00089  */
00090 typedef struct {
00091     /* Note: these are referenced from assembly routines in the bootloader,
00092      * so this structure should not be changed without changing those
00093      * routines as well.
00094      */
00095     uint64_t next_block_addr;
00096     uint64_t size;
00097 
00098 } cvmx_bootmem_block_header_t;
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * Structure for named memory blocks
00102  * Number of descriptors
00103  * available can be changed without affecting compatiblity,
00104  * but name length changes require a bump in the bootmem
00105  * descriptor version
00106  * Note: This structure must be naturally 64 bit aligned, as a single
00107  * memory image will be used by both 32 and 64 bit programs.
00108  */
00109 struct cvmx_bootmem_named_block_desc {
00110     uint64_t base_addr;
00111                 /**< Base address of named block */
00112     uint64_t size;
00113                 /**< Size actually allocated for named block (may differ from requested) */
00114     char name[CVMX_BOOTMEM_NAME_LEN];
00115                     /**< name of named block */
00116 };
00117 
00118 typedef struct cvmx_bootmem_named_block_desc cvmx_bootmem_named_block_desc_t;
00119 
00120 /* Current descriptor versions */
00121 #define CVMX_BOOTMEM_DESC_MAJ_VER   3   /* CVMX bootmem descriptor major version */
00122 #define CVMX_BOOTMEM_DESC_MIN_VER   0   /* CVMX bootmem descriptor minor version */
00123 
00124 /* First three members of cvmx_bootmem_desc_t are left in original
00125 ** positions for backwards compatibility.
00126 */
00127 typedef struct {
00128     /* Linux compatible proxy for __BIG_ENDIAN */
00129 #if defined(__BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD) || defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST)
00130     uint32_t lock;
00131                 /**< spinlock to control access to list */
00132     uint32_t flags;
00133                 /**< flags for indicating various conditions */
00134     uint64_t head_addr;
00135 
00136     uint32_t major_version;
00137                 /**< incremented changed when incompatible changes made */
00138     uint32_t minor_version;
00139                 /**< incremented changed when compatible changes made, reset to zero when major incremented */
00140     uint64_t app_data_addr;
00141     uint64_t app_data_size;
00142 
00143     uint32_t named_block_num_blocks;
00144                      /**< number of elements in named blocks array */
00145     uint32_t named_block_name_len;
00146                      /**< length of name array in bootmem blocks */
00147     uint64_t named_block_array_addr;
00148                      /**< address of named memory block descriptors */
00149 #else               /* __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00150     uint32_t flags;
00151     uint32_t lock;
00152     uint64_t head_addr;
00153 
00154     uint32_t minor_version;
00155     uint32_t major_version;
00156     uint64_t app_data_addr;
00157     uint64_t app_data_size;
00158 
00159     uint32_t named_block_name_len;
00160     uint32_t named_block_num_blocks;
00161     uint64_t named_block_array_addr;
00162 #endif
00163 } cvmx_bootmem_desc_t;
00164 
00165 /**
00166  * Initialize the boot alloc memory structures. This is
00167  * normally called inside of cvmx_user_app_init()
00168  *
00169  * @param mem_desc_addr Address of the free memory list
00170  * @return
00171  */
00172 extern int cvmx_bootmem_init(uint64_t mem_desc_addr);
00173 
00174 /**
00175  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was passed
00176  * to the application by the bootloader.
00177  * This is an allocate-only algorithm, so freeing memory is not possible.
00178  *
00179  * @param size      Size in bytes of block to allocate
00180  * @param alignment Alignment required - must be power of 2
00181  *
00182  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00183  */
00184 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc(uint64_t size, uint64_t alignment);
00185 
00186 /**
00187  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was passed
00188  * to the application by the bootloader from a specific node.
00189  * This is an allocate-only algorithm, so freeing memory is not possible.
00190  *
00191  * @param node  The node to allocate memory from
00192  * @param size  Size in bytes of block to allocate
00193  * @param alignment Alignment required - must be power of 2
00194  *
00195  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00196  */
00197 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_node(uint64_t node, uint64_t size, uint64_t alignment);
00198 
00199 /**
00200  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was
00201  * passed to the application by the bootloader at a specific
00202  * address. This is an allocate-only algorithm, so
00203  * freeing memory is not possible. Allocation will fail if
00204  * memory cannot be allocated at the specified address.
00205  *
00206  * @param size      Size in bytes of block to allocate
00207  * @param address   Physical address to allocate memory at.  If this
00208  *                  memory is not available, the allocation fails.
00209  * @param alignment Alignment required - must be power of 2
00210  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00211  */
00212 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_address(uint64_t size, uint64_t address,
00213                     uint64_t alignment);
00214 
00215 /**
00216  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was
00217  * passed to the application by the bootloader within a specified
00218  * address range. This is an allocate-only algorithm, so
00219  * freeing memory is not possible. Allocation will fail if
00220  * memory cannot be allocated in the requested range.
00221  *
00222  * @param size      Size in bytes of block to allocate
00223  * @param min_addr  defines the minimum address of the range
00224  * @param max_addr  defines the maximum address of the range
00225  * @param alignment Alignment required - must be power of 2
00226  * @param flags     Flags to control options for the allocation.
00227  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00228  */
00229 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_range_flags(uint64_t size, uint64_t alignment,
00230                         uint64_t min_addr,
00231                         uint64_t max_addr, uint32_t flags);
00232 
00233 /**
00234  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was
00235  * passed to the application by the bootloader within a specified
00236  * address range. This is an allocate-only algorithm, so
00237  * freeing memory is not possible. Allocation will fail if
00238  * memory cannot be allocated in the requested range.
00239  *
00240  * @param size      Size in bytes of block to allocate
00241  * @param min_addr  defines the minimum address of the range
00242  * @param max_addr  defines the maximum address of the range
00243  * @param alignment Alignment required - must be power of 2
00244  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00245  */
00246 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_range(uint64_t size, uint64_t alignment,
00247                       uint64_t min_addr, uint64_t max_addr);
00248 
00249 /**
00250  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was passed
00251  * to the application by the bootloader, and assign it a name in the
00252  * global named block table.  (part of the cvmx_bootmem_descriptor_t structure)
00253  * Named blocks can later be freed.
00254  *
00255  * @param size  Size in bytes of block to allocate
00256  * @param alignment Alignment required - must be power of 2
00257  * @param name  name of block - must be less than CVMX_BOOTMEM_NAME_LEN bytes
00258  *
00259  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00260  */
00261 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_named(uint64_t size, uint64_t alignment,
00262                       const char *name);
00263 
00264 /**
00265  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was passed
00266  * to the application by the bootloader, and assign it a name in the
00267  * global named block table.  (part of the cvmx_bootmem_descriptor_t structure)
00268  * Named blocks can later be freed.
00269  *
00270  * @param size Size in bytes of block to allocate
00271  * @param alignment Alignment required - must be power of 2
00272  * @param name name of block - must be less than CVMX_BOOTMEM_NAME_LEN bytes
00273  * @param flags     Flags to control options for the allocation.
00274  *
00275  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00276  */
00277 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_named_flags(uint64_t size, uint64_t alignment,
00278                         const char *name, uint32_t flags);
00279 
00280 /**
00281  * Allocate a block of memory from the free list that was passed
00282  * to the application by the bootloader, and assign it a name in the
00283  * global named block table.  (part of the cvmx_bootmem_descriptor_t structure)
00284  * Named blocks can later be freed.
00285  *
00286  * @param size    Size in bytes of block to allocate
00287  * @param address Physical address to allocate memory at.  If this
00288  *                memory is not available, the allocation fails.
00289  * @param name    name of block - must be less than CVMX_BOOTMEM_NAME_LEN bytes
00290  *
00291  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00292  */
00293 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_named_address(uint64_t size, uint64_t address,
00294                           const char *name);
00295 
00296 /**
00297  * Allocate a block of memory from a specific range of the free list
00298  * that was passed to the application by the bootloader, and assign it
00299  * a name in the global named block table.  (part of the
00300  * cvmx_bootmem_descriptor_t structure) Named blocks can later be
00301  * freed.  If request cannot be satisfied within the address range
00302  * specified, NULL is returned
00303  *
00304  * @param size      Size in bytes of block to allocate
00305  * @param min_addr  minimum address of range
00306  * @param max_addr  maximum address of range
00307  * @param align  Alignment of memory to be allocated. (must be a power of 2)
00308  * @param name   name of block - must be less than CVMX_BOOTMEM_NAME_LEN bytes
00309  *
00310  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00311  */
00312 extern void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_named_range(uint64_t size, uint64_t min_addr,
00313                         uint64_t max_addr, uint64_t align,
00314                         const char *name);
00315 
00316 /**
00317  * Allocate if needed a block of memory from a specific range of the
00318  * free list that was passed to the application by the bootloader, and
00319  * assign it a name in the global named block table.  (part of the
00320  * cvmx_bootmem_descriptor_t structure) Named blocks can later be
00321  * freed.  If the requested name block is already allocated, return
00322  * the pointer to block of memory.  If request cannot be satisfied
00323  * within the address range specified, NULL is returned
00324  *
00325  * @param size   Size in bytes of block to allocate
00326  * @param min_addr  minimum address of range
00327  * @param max_addr  maximum address of range
00328  * @param align  Alignment of memory to be allocated. (must be a power of 2)
00329  * @param name   name of block - must be less than CVMX_BOOTMEM_NAME_LEN bytes
00330  * @param init   Initialization function
00331  *
00332  * The initialization function is optional, if omitted the named block
00333  * is initialized to all zeros when it is created, i.e. once.
00334  *
00335  * @return pointer to block of memory, NULL on error
00336  */
00337 void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_named_range_once(uint64_t size,
00338                       uint64_t min_addr,
00339                       uint64_t max_addr,
00340                       uint64_t align,
00341                       const char *name,
00342                       void (*init) (void *));
00343 
00344 /**
00345  * Allocate all free memory starting at the start address.  This is used to
00346  * prevent any free blocks from later being allocated within the reserved space.
00347  * Note that any memory allocated with this function cannot be later freed.
00348  *
00349  * @param start_addr  Starting address to reserve
00350  * @param size        Size in bytes to reserve starting at start_addr
00351  * @param name        Name to assign to reserved blocks
00352  * @param flags       Flags to use when reserving memory
00353  *
00354  * @return 0 on failure,
00355  *         !0 on success
00356  */
00357 extern int cvmx_bootmem_reserve_memory(uint64_t start_addr, uint64_t size,
00358                        const char *name, uint32_t flags);
00359 
00360 /**
00361  * Frees a previously allocated named bootmem block.
00362  *
00363  * @param name   name of block to free
00364  *
00365  * @return 0 on failure,
00366  *         !0 on success
00367  */
00368 extern int cvmx_bootmem_free_named(const char *name);
00369 
00370 
00371 /**
00372  * Finds a named bootmem block by name.
00373  *
00374  * @param name   name of block to free
00375  *
00376  * @return pointer to named block descriptor on success
00377  *         0 on failure
00378  */
00379 const cvmx_bootmem_named_block_desc_t *cvmx_bootmem_find_named_block(const char *name);
00380 
00381 /**
00382  * Returns the size of available memory in bytes, only
00383  * counting blocks that are at least as big as the minimum block
00384  * size.
00385  *
00386  * @param min_block_size
00387  *               Minimum block size to count in total.
00388  *
00389  * @return Number of bytes available for allocation that meet the
00390  * block size requirement
00391  */
00392 uint64_t cvmx_bootmem_available_mem(uint64_t min_block_size);
00393 
00394 /**
00395  * Prints out the list of named blocks that have been allocated
00396  * along with their addresses and sizes.
00397  * This is primarily used for debugging purposes
00398  */
00399 void cvmx_bootmem_print_named(void);
00400 
00401 /**
00402  * Allocates a block of physical memory from the free list, at
00403  * (optional) requested address and alignment.
00404  *
00405  * @param req_size size of region to allocate.  All requests are
00406  * rounded up to be a multiple CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE bytes size
00407  *
00408  * @param address_min Minimum address that block can occupy.
00409  *
00410  * @param address_max Specifies the maximum address_min (inclusive)
00411  * that the allocation can use.
00412  *
00413  * @param alignment Requested alignment of the block.  If this
00414  *                  alignment cannot be met, the allocation fails.
00415  *                  This must be a power of 2.  (Note: Alignment of
00416  *                  CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE bytes is required, and
00417  *                  internally enforced.  Requested alignments of less
00418  *                  than CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE are set to
00419  *                  CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE.)
00420  * @param flags     Flags to control options for the allocation.
00421  *
00422  * @return physical address of block allocated, or -1 on failure
00423  */
00424 int64_t cvmx_bootmem_phy_alloc(uint64_t req_size, uint64_t address_min,
00425                    uint64_t address_max, uint64_t alignment,
00426                    uint32_t flags);
00427 
00428 /**
00429  * Allocates a named block of physical memory from the free list, at
00430  * (optional) requested address and alignment.
00431  *
00432  * @param size size of region to allocate.  All requests are rounded
00433  * up to be a multiple CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE bytes size
00434  *
00435  * @param min_addr  Minimum address that block can occupy.
00436  *
00437  * @param max_addr Specifies the maximum address_min (inclusive) that
00438  * the allocation can use.
00439  *
00440  * @param alignment Requested alignment of the block.  If this
00441  *                  alignment cannot be met, the allocation fails.
00442  *                  This must be a power of 2.  (Note: Alignment of
00443  *                  CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE bytes is required, and
00444  *                  internally enforced.  Requested alignments of less
00445  *                  than CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE are set to
00446  *                  CVMX_BOOTMEM_ALIGNMENT_SIZE.)
00447  *
00448  * @param name      name to assign to named block
00449  *
00450  * @param flags     Flags to control options for the allocation.
00451  *
00452  * @return physical address of block allocated, or -1 on failure
00453  */
00454 int64_t cvmx_bootmem_phy_named_block_alloc(uint64_t size, uint64_t min_addr,
00455                        uint64_t max_addr,
00456                        uint64_t alignment,
00457                        const char *name, uint32_t flags);
00458 
00459 /**
00460  * Finds a named memory block by name.
00461  * Also used for finding an unused entry in the named block table.
00462  *
00463  * @param name Name of memory block to find.  If NULL pointer given,
00464  *             then finds unused descriptor, if available.
00465  *
00466  * @param flags  Flags to control options for the allocation.
00467  *
00468  * @return Physical address of the memory block descriptor, zero if not
00469  *         found. If zero returned when name parameter is NULL, then no
00470  *         memory block descriptors are available.
00471  */
00472 uint64_t cvmx_bootmem_phy_named_block_find(const char *name, uint32_t flags);
00473 
00474 /**
00475  * Returns the size of available memory in bytes, only
00476  * counting blocks that are at least as big as the minimum block
00477  * size.
00478  *
00479  * @param min_block_size
00480  *               Minimum block size to count in total.
00481  *
00482  * @return Number of bytes available for allocation that meet the
00483  * block size requirement
00484  */
00485 uint64_t cvmx_bootmem_phy_available_mem(uint64_t min_block_size);
00486 
00487 /**
00488  * Frees a named block.
00489  *
00490  * @param name   name of block to free
00491  * @param flags  flags for passing options
00492  *
00493  * @return 0 on failure
00494  *         1 on success
00495  */
00496 int cvmx_bootmem_phy_named_block_free(const char *name, uint32_t flags);
00497 
00498 /**
00499  * Frees a block to the bootmem allocator list.  This must
00500  * be used with care, as the size provided must match the size
00501  * of the block that was allocated, or the list will become
00502  * corrupted.
00503  *
00504  * IMPORTANT:  This is only intended to be used as part of named block
00505  * frees and initial population of the free memory list.
00506  *                                                      *
00507  *
00508  * @param phy_addr physical address of block
00509  * @param size     size of block in bytes.
00510  * @param flags    flags for passing options
00511  *
00512  * @return 1 on success,
00513  *         0 on failure
00514  */
00515 int __cvmx_bootmem_phy_free(uint64_t phy_addr, uint64_t size, uint32_t flags);
00516 
00517 /**
00518  * Prints the list of currently allocated named blocks
00519  *
00520  */
00521 void cvmx_bootmem_phy_named_block_print(void);
00522 
00523 /**
00524  * Prints the list of available memory.
00525  *
00526  */
00527 void cvmx_bootmem_phy_list_print(void);
00528 
00529 /**
00530  * This function initializes the free memory list used by cvmx_bootmem.
00531  * This must be called before any allocations can be done.
00532  *
00533  * @param mem_size Total memory available, in bytes
00534  *
00535  * @param low_reserved_bytes Number of bytes to reserve (leave out of
00536  * free list) at address 0x0.
00537  *
00538  * @param desc_buffer Buffer for the bootmem descriptor.  This must be
00539  *                 a 32 bit addressable address.
00540  *
00541  * @return 1 on success
00542  *         0 on failure
00543  */
00544 int64_t cvmx_bootmem_phy_mem_list_init(uint64_t mem_size,
00545                        uint32_t low_reserved_bytes,
00546                        cvmx_bootmem_desc_t * desc_buffer);
00547 
00548 /**
00549  * This function initializes the free memory list used by cvmx_bootmem.
00550  * This must be called before any allocations can be done.
00551  *
00552  * @param nodemask Nodemask - one bit per node (bit0->node0, bit1->node1,...)
00553  *
00554  * @param mem_size[] Array of memory sizes in MBytes per node ([0]->node0,...)
00555  *
00556  * @param low_reserved_bytes Number of bytes to reserve (leave out of
00557  * free list) at address 0x0.
00558  *
00559  * @param desc_buffer Buffer for the bootmem descriptor.  This must be
00560  *                 a 32 bit addressable address.
00561  *
00562  * @return 1 on success
00563  *         0 on failure
00564  */
00565 int64_t cvmx_bootmem_phy_mem_list_init_multi(uint8_t nodemask,
00566                        uint32_t mem_size[],
00567                        uint32_t low_reserved_bytes,
00568                        cvmx_bootmem_desc_t * desc_buffer);
00569 /**
00570  * Locks the bootmem allocator.  This is useful in certain situations
00571  * where multiple allocations must be made without being interrupted.
00572  * This should be used with the CVMX_BOOTMEM_FLAG_NO_LOCKING flag.
00573  *
00574  */
00575 void cvmx_bootmem_lock(void);
00576 
00577 /**
00578  * Unlocks the bootmem allocator.  This is useful in certain situations
00579  * where multiple allocations must be made without being interrupted.
00580  * This should be used with the CVMX_BOOTMEM_FLAG_NO_LOCKING flag.
00581  *
00582  */
00583 void cvmx_bootmem_unlock(void);
00584 
00585 /**
00586  * Internal use function to get the current descriptor pointer */
00587 void *__cvmx_bootmem_internal_get_desc_ptr(void);
00588 
00589 /**
00590  * Internal use.  This is userd to get a pointer to a physical
00591  * address.  For linux n32 the physical address in mmaped to a virtual
00592  * address and the virtual address is returned.  For n64 the address
00593  * is converted to an xkphys address and the xkhpys address is
00594  * returned.
00595  */
00596 void *__cvmx_phys_addr_to_ptr(uint64_t phys, int size);
00597 const cvmx_bootmem_named_block_desc_t *
00598 __cvmx_bootmem_find_named_block_flags(const char *name, uint32_t flags);
00599 void *cvmx_bootmem_alloc_named_range_flags(uint64_t size, uint64_t min_addr,
00600                        uint64_t max_addr, uint64_t align,
00601                        const char *name, uint32_t flags);
00602 uint64_t cvmx_bootmem_phy_alloc_range(uint64_t size, uint64_t alignment,
00603                       uint64_t min_addr, uint64_t max_addr);
